item.title: Roblox CEO interview gets heated over child safety
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Roblox CEO Dave Baszuki joined the Hard Fork podcast to discuss the gaming platform’s new age verification feature — but he seemed to get frustrated at the number of questions focused on child safety.

item.title: X’s new About This Account feature is going great
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A new feature seemingly revealed many right-wing “America First” accounts are actually based outside the United States. But the data seems questionable.

item.title: AI is too risky to insure, say people whose job is insuring risk
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Major insurers including AIG, Great American, and WR Berkley are asking U.S. regulators for permission to exclude AI-related liabilities from corporate policies. One underwriter describes the AI models’ outputs to the FT as "too much of a black box."

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Searching for the robotaxi tipping point
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Beehiiv’s CEO isn’t worried about newsletter saturation
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Beehiiv's co-founder and CEO Tyler Denk spoke to TechCrunch about why the company has been expanding, and where the media business is going next.

item.title: ChatGPT told them they were special — their families say it led to tragedy
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Amanda Silberling
item.description: A wave of lawsuits against OpenAI detail how ChatGPT used manipulative language to isolate users from loved ones and make itself into their sole confidant.

item.title: Trump administration might not fight state AI regulations after all
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A Trump administration order targeting state-level AI regulation is reportedly on hold.

item.title: Waymo gets regulatory approval to expand across Bay Area and Southern California
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Waymo continues to expand its reach, with the robotaxi company posting Friday that it’s now “officially authorized to drive fully autonomously across more of the Golden State.”

item.title: Meta wants to get into the electricity trading business
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: In order to accelerate the construction of new power plants needed to provide energy for its data centers, Meta is looking to get into the business of trading electricity.

item.title: Byju’s founder to appeal U.S. court order to pay over $1B in bankruptcy case
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: A U.S. bankruptcy court has ordered Byju's founder Byju Raveendran to pay over $1.07 billion in a case over missing company funds.

item.title: Why now is the best time to invest in climate tech
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Global expectations around climate change has shifted dramatically in the last decade, suggesting that similarly significant changes are on the horizon.

item.title: Pew’s latest social media report shows X’s staying power in the U.S., despite competition
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: X is still used by 21% of U.S. adults, Pew found, only down from 23% in 2021, despite increased competition from Meta, startups, and decentralized social media.

item.title: How this founder’s unlikely path to Silicon Valley could become an edge in industrial tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Young's age and background – things that might seem like disadvantages when it comes to more established industries – have become his secret weapons. When he walks into a room of executives twice or three times his age, he says, there's initial skepticism. "Who the hell is this young guy and how does he know what he's talking about?"

item.title: Bret Taylor’s Sierra reaches $100M ARR in under two years
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The startup’s rapid growth suggests that enerprises are embracing AI agents.

item.title: The hottest AI wearables and gadgets you can buy right now
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: We compiled all the hottest AI wearables currently available, including Bee, Friend, Plaud, and more.

item.title: CrowdStrike fires ‘suspicious insider’ who passed information to hackers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker, Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Cybersecurity giant CrowdStrike denied it had been hacked following claims from a hacker group, which leaked screenshots from inside CrowdStrike's network.

item.title: Google says hackers stole data from 200 companies following Gainsight breach
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Notorious hacking collective Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters takes credit for the breach that affected Salesforce customers’ data, and said it is planning another extortion campaign.

item.title: X begins rolling out the ‘About this account’ feature to users’ profiles
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature will show where users are based, how they're connected to X, and how many times they've changed their username.

item.title: Impersonators are (still) targeting companies with fake TechCrunch outreach
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Staff
item.description: Fraudsters are impersonating TechCrunch reporters and event leads, and reaching out to companies. Here's what we're doing about it, and what you can look out for.

item.title: Phictly’s new app brings people together over their favorite books and TV shows
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Phictly helps fans find niche clubs for their favorite books, shows, and movies, offering intimate, spoiler-safe communities with flexible pacing and tracker tools.
